content.webTitle: Fight to stop demolition of county cricket pavilion

fields.headline: Fight to stop demolition of county cricket pavilion
fields.bodyText: A campaign has been launched to save the Victorian cricket pavilion at Boughton Park sports ground in Worcester where WG Grace made his first appearance in the Midlands, aged 20. The pavilion was added in 1878 for Worcestershire county cricket club before they moved to New Road in 1896. It was declared unsafe last year and faces demolition as part of redevelopment of a factory site. Adam Wilkinson, secretary of conservation group Save, said yesterday: "This handsome cricket pavilion must not go. It is very much a part of Worcestershire's and the nation's proud cricketing heritage."
